description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b9952","text":"We present a step-by-step methodology for tracking the coverage of publications available in the CRIS (Current Research Information System) infrastructure of the University of Bologna and implemented in the IRIS platform, within the databases of OpenCitations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d87rm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mmik","text":"The methodology filters and transforms data dumps from IRIS and OpenCitations Meta and Index to create novel datasets that are used to perform quantitative analysis on the subject matter. Specifically, we quantify the proportion of IRIS publications included in OpenCitations Meta, examine the types of publications best covered, evaluate the number of citations within OpenCitations Index involving IRIS publications as either citing or cited entities, and the extent to which these citations reference works outside of IRIS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1djtk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48umb","text":"The research questions addressed in the study are:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9d1b","text":"What is the coverage of the publications available in IRIS (strictly concerning research conducted within the University of Bologna) in OpenCitations Meta?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58da2","text":"What are the types of publications that are better covered in the portion of OpenCitations Meta covered by IRIS?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"709ir","text":"What is the amount of citations (according to OpenCitations Index) coming from the IRIS publications that is involved in OpenCitations Meta (as citing entity and as cited entity)?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aple3","text":"How many of these citations come from and go to publications that are not included in IRIS?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhovg","text":"How many of these citations involve publications in IRIS as both citing and cited entities?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Creation of a unique list of PIDs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"24tjn","text":"In order to remove the duplicates present in the list, we first filter this list to keep only the first occurrence of cases in which the same IRIS record had more than one PID associated to it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fm286","text":"Given how the list has been constructed (DOIs are listed before PMIDs and ISBNs are last), the filtering is applied with a hierarchical order of preference for the picking of a single PID for each IRIS entry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Creation of a unique list of PIDs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7hu81","text":"Next, multiple IRIS records associated to the same PID are deduplicated, keeping only one occurrence of each PID. To pick the best entry out of the records that shared the same PID, the three types of identifier are processed separately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43h85","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecm39","text":"To deduplicate DOIs, the following methodology is implemented:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c17qg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6iage","text":"Out of the duplicates with the same DOI and the same type, the first one occurring in the list is kept","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s5up","text":"For the duplicates with the same DOI and different type, the duplicates are sorted according to a priority list based on the type of the record, and the resulting top record is kept.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mj4d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4453d","text":"The preference list for DOIs is devised as follows, from highest priority to lowest:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5did","text":"35 - 1.01 Articolo in rivista","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cd1k8","text":"50 -  3.02 Curatela","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3lro","text":"41 - 2.01 Capitolo / saggio in libro","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3urt","text":"57 - 4.01 Contributo in Atti di convegno","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Creation of a unique list of PIDs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"32g1m","text":"To deduplicate PMIDs, first the duplicates with type '40 - Abstract' are removed and the first occurrence of each PMID with type '35 - Articolo in rivista' are kept.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Creation of a unique list of PIDs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8tv14","text":"To deduplicate ISBNs, the same methodology used for the DOIs, with a different priority list, is implemented:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqbet","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1aa6u","text":"Out of the duplicates with the same ISBN and the same type, the first one occurring in the list is kept","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rvfv","text":"For the duplicates with the same ISBN and different type, the duplicates are sorted according to a priority list based on the type of the record, and the resulting top record is kept.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5kn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94k2k","text":"The preference list for ISBNs is devised as follows, from highest priority to lowest:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b294","text":"49 - 3.01 Monografia","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1elk","text":"35 - 1.01 Articolo in rivista","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":59,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hcl6","text":"This dataset contains all the bibliographic records from the IRIS dump that have a DOI, ISBN or PMID but that have not been found in the OCMeta dump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2l3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55vqt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1fr76","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm0cr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":4,"offset":95}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6vpms","text":"If you want to skip the creation of this dataset, you can download the final processed dataset here.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7fn4","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fi03q","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"1CEB5C3423354164A918DC13EB08F2D8","url":"https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.25897708.v2"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"},"1":{"data":{"affiliation":null,"can_edit":true,"guid":"23AFC27E6ACE11EFB48C0A58A9FEAC02","link":"https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.25897708.v2","name":"Iris Not In Meta"},"mutability":"IMMUTABLE","type":"dataset"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"br7ad","text":"To create this dataset, the following methodology is adopted:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3803l","text":"Retrieve the deduplicated list of unique PIDs from the IRIS dump as in section 4.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cradm","text":"Read the Iris In Meta dataset.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":9,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d17i2","text":"Perform an anti join between the Iris In Meta dataframe and the list of PIDs on the 'iris_id' column.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":84,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d60o","text":"Write the resulting dataframe to a .parquet file.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"376vj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elm7j","text":"You can perform this step by executing the following command:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8okk8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bo3bo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"6B6EC93D772E11EF82E30A58A9FEAC02","name":"python3 scripts/create_datasets.py -meta \u003cpath_to_meta_zip\u003e -iris \u003cpath_to_iris_zip\u003e --iris_not_in_meta","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}
